body_html:
Thanks for the contribution. A couple of issues with the current code:

  1. We need to support tensors with more than 2 dimensions.
  2. tf.transpose is more general than simply reversing the indices, but takes an optional argument with a permutation of [0...n-1]. I think we should support this functionality for sparse tensors as well. I think your can use tf.gather to reorder the columns of the index tensor.
body_text:
Thanks for the contribution. A couple of issues with the current code:

We need to support tensors with more than 2 dimensions.
tf.transpose is more general than simply reversing the indices, but takes an optional argument with a permutation of [0...n-1]. I think we should support this functionality for sparse tensors as well. I think your can use tf.gather to reorder the columns of the index tensor.
body:
Thanks for the contribution. A couple of issues with the current code:
1. We need to support tensors with more than 2 dimensions.
2. tf.transpose is more general than simply reversing the indices, but takes an optional argument with a permutation of [0...n-1]. I think we should support this functionality for sparse tensors as well. I think your can use tf.gather to reorder the columns of the index tensor.
